intro: Geonoma campylostachys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved basket palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, clustered stems and elongated, narrow leaves that form a dense rosette. Its inflorescence consists of a branched cluster of small, inconspicuous flowers. Geonoma campylostachys is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
